sorular.soru: Can you stop here for a moment?

feedback.metin: You may stop or park here as long as you do not inconvenience or endanger other traffic. Stopping here is no more inconvenient than if you parked alongside the pavement in a more narrow road.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to motor vehicles with trailers.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?

feedback.metin: You must give way to the bus who is approaching from the right. However, he cannot turn left because of the length of the vehicle. You should have stopped earlier so that the bus could turn to the left.

sorular.soru: Should you indicate if you are going to shift to the right?

feedback.metin: At every important lateral movement, you must indicate direction. This also includes overtaking other motor vehicles. You must indicate both direction to the left before overtaking and direction to the right if you want to move to the right again after overtaking.

sorular.soru: What is stopping distance?

feedback.metin: Stopping distance is determined by the time you take to react to a situation and the time it takes for your vehicle to come to a stop. The time it takes to hit the brake pedal with your foot is known as thinking distance. The distance you cover between applying the brakes and coming to a stop is called braking distance.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: The end of a 70 km/h speed limit is indicated here. The number on the sign indicates which speed limit has ended. The priority sign after the intersection means that this road is outside a built-up area, so the speed limit here is 80 km/h.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to change lanes here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on an open rush-hour lane, which is indicated by sign C-23-1. Here, the hard shoulder is used as an extra lane. In this case, you may cross the solid line.

sorular.soru: At what point in this situation should you indicate right?
cevaplar: As soon as you enter the roundabout.
You do not have to indicate.

feedback.metin: If you want to go three-quarters of the way around a roundabout – i.e. turn left – indicate left before entering the roundabout. If you are driving around the roundabout, indicate right immediately after the second exit. Doing this any earlier, or not at all, will confuse other traffic entering the roundabout.

sorular.soru: Should you expect moped riders from the right?

feedback.metin: The sign C-4 indicates a one-way street and is placed at T-intersections. You are required to follow the road to the right. Cyclists and moped riders are exempt from this traffic sign. They may follow this one-way street in both directions. So you can expect oncoming cyclists and moped riders.

sorular.soru: What traffic category does a person walking with a bicycle, moped, or motorcycle fall into?
cevaplar: A pedestrian if on the pavement, a driver if on the carriageway.

feedback.metin: Anyone walking and pushing a bicycle, moped, or motorcycle by hand is classed as a pedestrian – regardless of where they are walking.

sorular.soru: Do the matrix signs indicate the end of the motorway?

feedback.metin: These matrix signs, or electronic signal signs, indicate the end of all previously by matrix sign indicated prohibitions. For example, they may lift a speed limit, or a previously indicated ban on overtaking for lorries. It therefore does not mean the end of the motorway.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a frayed seat belt?

feedback.metin: All seat belts must be securely fastened and must not be damaged or frayed. Pilling of the belt fabric is not considered damage.

sorular.soru: Is it better for the environment if you switch off the combustion engine while waiting?

feedback.metin: If you are waiting somewhere for an extended period of time, switching off the combustion engine saves fuel.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: It is prohibited to stand still next to a solid yellow line. This means you are also not allowed to park here. Therefore, it is also prohibited to make a phone call here.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the lorry on the right?

feedback.metin: You can overtake on the left or right immediately before as well as on a roundabout.

sorular.soru: Can you transport children in the boot at a children's party?

feedback.metin: No more passengers may be transported in a car than there are seats with seat belts. Not even occasionally, such as at a children's party. It is not allowed to transport passengers in the boot of the car.

sorular.soru: Which window would be the best to break in case you hit the water with your car?

feedback.metin: If you hit the water with your car, you have to exit your vehicle as soon as possible. If the windows will not open anymore, you have to break them with the safety hammer. You do this with a side window. The windscreen is made of laminated glass with foil in between and does not break apart easily. The side windows are made of safety glass which break into small pieces as soon as you break it. Because the rear window is provided with wiring for rear window heating, it breaks harder as well. Your rear window is also less accessible. Only if your side window does not break, you go to different window.

sorular.soru: Can you drive at 100 km/h here?

feedback.metin: You are passing a sign that indicates the end of a recommended speed limit. On ordinary roads outside built-up areas the speed limit is 80 km/h unless signage indicates otherwise.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The box being transported is covering the gear lever, which means the driver cannot properly shift gears. Even if the car is automatic and changing gears is not required, you still need to be able to reach the gearbox easily. Cargo that impedes your driving is prohibited, so you cannot drive like this.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: The E-2 sign indicates that you are not allowed to stop on that side of the road. However, this does not apply to parking spaces or a parking strip. If there is a parking lane on the side where the sign E-2 is located, you may park in it.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a defective speedometer?

feedback.metin: While driving with a defective odometer is allowed, driving with a defective speedometer is prohibited. Odometers and speedometers are different – an odometer measures the distance a vehicle has travelled, while a speedometer indicates the vehicle’s speed.

sorular.soru: What happens if you do not follow a mandatory educational course such as the LEMA, EMA, or EMG?
cevaplar: Your driving licence will be invalidated.
sorular.dogruCevap: Your driving licence will be invalidated.

feedback.metin: If you do not follow a mandatory educational course such as the LEMA, EMA, EMD, LEMG or EMG, your driving licence will be invalidated and you will have to re-obtain it. Those courses can be imposed for speeding, antisocial driving behaviour or driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs.

sorular.soru: What do these zigzag lines on the road mean?
cevaplar: Warning of a dangerous traffic situation.
Warning of an unguarded level crossing.
sorular.dogruCevap: Warning of a dangerous traffic situation.

feedback.metin: The zigzag line means that you are approaching a dangerous traffic situation. It says nothing about the priority. What it does mean is that it is best to reduce your speed.

sorular.soru: Is a trolleybus a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages are vehicles that run on a motor and do not use tracks (e.g. train, metro, tram). Bicycles with pedal assistance are also not motor carriages, however speed pedelecs are. A trolleybus is also a motor carriage.

sorular.soru: Can you use the hard shoulder in this situation?

feedback.metin: A hard shoulder is a part of the road that is separated from an autoweg or motorway and is intended for emergencies. If you have to swerve unexpectedly, you are in an emergency situation and are therefore allowed to use the hard shoulder.

sorular.soru: What kind of lighting should you use here?

feedback.metin: If you are driving in a tunnel, you must use dipped headlights. You must switch on the dipped headlights well before you enter the tunnel.

sorular.soru: What kind of bend presents the lowest risk of an accident in case of excessive speed?
cevaplar: A bend with a negative road banking.
A bend with a positive road banking.
A bend without a road banking.
sorular.dogruCevap: A bend with a positive road banking.

feedback.metin: If you approach a bend too fast, you risk not making the bend and skidding. This risk is lowest at bends with a positive road banking. A positive road banking means the outer bend is higher than the inner bend, so the centrifugal force is partially absorbed. On bends with a negative road banking, the opposite is true and the centrifugal force is somewhat increased.

sorular.soru: In what situation are you allowed to park here with an electric car?
cevaplar: If you want to park for a maximum of 2 hours.

feedback.metin: At a parking space with this sign, you may only park while charging your electric car. When you have finished charging, you must move your car so that others can also charge their vehicles.

sorular.soru: Should the pedestrian on the right give way to you?

feedback.metin: The pedestrian must give way to you before crossing the road. You do not have to give way to a pedestrian coming from the left or the right, unless there is a pedestrian crossing or if you are driving into or out of an exit construction. Pedestrians are not drivers.

sorular.soru: Is a separate caravan insurance mandatory?

feedback.metin: Caravans are usually insured through the towing vehicle’s car insurance, as indicated by the letters AF on the insurance card, where F stands for trailer. Any damage you cause to other vehicles is insured as long as the trailer or caravan is connected to the vehicle. To insure against damage caused to your trailer or caravan itself, you must take out separate insurance. This is not mandatory, however.

sorular.soru: When can you use your horn to warn others of imminent danger?
cevaplar: Both inside and outside built-up areas.
sorular.dogruCevap: Both inside and outside built-up areas.

feedback.metin: You may not use light or sound signals unnecessarily. This is only allowed when warning other road users of imminent danger, which is permitted both inside and outside built-up areas.

sorular.soru: Does fatigue impair your ability to drive?

feedback.metin: There are several factors that can impair your ability to drive, such as being tired. The use of drugs or stimulants can also have a negative effect on driving skills.

sorular.soru: It is 1:00 PM. How fast are you allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on a motorway with a speed limit of 100 km/h at this time of the day. The lower sign indicates a speed limit of 90 km/h when the road surface is wet.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Use light signals and enter the other side of the road.
Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
Sound your horn, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down, use light signals, and drive carefully onto the verge.

feedback.metin: If an overtaking, oncoming vehicle has misjudged a manoeuvre, warn them using light signals. Brake as much as possible in your own lane and, if necessary, steer onto the verge at low speed.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?
cevaplar: Yes. But the airbag must be disabled.
No. The child must be facing the direction of travel.
No. Children may only be placed on the back seat of the vehicle.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But the airbag must be disabled.

feedback.metin: Children may be placed in the front or back seat of the vehicle. An approved car seat is required for children up to 1.35 metres tall. Depending on the child’s age, this may be an infant car seat, a child car seat, or a booster seat. Keep the car seat installed in a rear-facing position for as long as possible. While not mandatory, this is the safest way to transport a child. Disabling the passenger airbag is advised for all children under 1.35 metres tall and even mandatory if the seat is installed in a rear-facing position.

sorular.soru: Does a traffic controller have the same authority as a police officer?

feedback.metin: You must always follow the instructions of a traffic controller, as well as those of a police officer. A traffic controller, however, does not have the same authority as a policeman. For example, a traffic controller may not ask you for your driving licence, take an alcohol test, or issue a speeding ticket.

sorular.soru: What does this sign mean?

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a pedestrian crossing. Drivers must give way to pedestrians and drivers of disabled vehicles who are crossing or about to cross a pedestrian crossing.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn right here?

feedback.metin: The yellow sign indicates a detour. You are not required to follow this sign, which means you can turn right here.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cyclist is continuing on the road you want to exit. Through traffic on the same road has priority over traffic turning off.
